comment.author: 25490134@N06
comment._content: This Building still exists, somehow: goo.gl/maps/gG2iH

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content:
Flugechse: So nice to know that the building is still there! It has obviously been renovated since 1927. In one of the photos in Panoramio, I can read the years 1479 and 1979, maybe the year of construction and the year of renovation?
Thanks a lot for sharing the information and posting the link! Vielen Dank! :)
/Anna B.

comment.author: 26641558@N06
comment._content: Beautiful building and photo! I am a little confused, however, as to what this has to do with Swedish National Heritage?

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content:
Paul Anthony Moore: Glad you like the photo! We want to show what we've got in our photo collections. Since our holdings also include photos from other countries, we want to share these too on Flickr. Besides, the Web is international... Hope you enjoy! :)
/Anna B.

comment.author: 26641558@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/swedish_heritage_board] With respect, the fact that the web is international is irrelevant to this situation (and to Flickr). In your Profile description, you make no mention that the photos in your archives are of places in other countries as well as Sweden. It simply states that you are "responsible for cultural heritage and historic environment issues in Sweden".  The operative word here is 'in'. I think that your archives are excellent and the photos are wonderful, but you need to decide what your aim is and amend your Profile description accordingly.  It would be less misleading then.

By the way, although I'm English, I lived in Skövde and Verberg in 1989 and have travelled extensively throughout Sweden. I'm a university English teacher.

comment.author: 25490134@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/swedish_heritage_board] Many old Buildings in Brunswick were destroyed during and after World War II, so i think it is a real coincidence that this building still exists.
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/rhedae] The photographer was swedish.

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/rhedae] You're quite right! I have now updated our profile information concerning our photo collections, so it will be clear that they also include photos from other countries than Sweden (as well as repro photos of other archival materials, soon to be presented on Flickr Commons). You may also find information about one of the reasons why we show photos from other countries in the text about the Berit Wallenberg collection, to which the photo on this page and many of our "foreign" photos belong. /Anna B.
